item.title: On the interpretation of regression coefficients
item.description: TLDR: We should interpret regression coefficients for continuous variables as we would descriptive dummy variables, unless we intend to make causal claims. I am going to be teaching regression labs in the Fall, and somehow, I stumbled onto Gelman and Hill’s Data analysis using regression and multilevel/hierarchical models.1 So I started reading it and it’s a good book.
